snippet: Republicans began voting in 10 states on Tuesday, with Mitt Romney and Rick Santorum engaged in a particularly competitive primary fight in Ohio.
abstract: Republican presidential candidate Mitt Romney visits factory workers in Canton, Ohio, while his opponent Rick Santorum speaks to veterans in Westerville; working-class has emerged as a potential decisive swing vote, particularly in Ohio, where voters earning $30,000 to $100,000 a year constitute 67 percent of the Republican primary electorate.

byline.original: By JIM RUTENBERG and JEFF ZELENY
byline.contributor: Ashley Parker contributed reporting from Canton, Ohio, and Allison Kopicki from New York.

lead_paragraph: Republicans began voting in 10 states on Tuesday, with Mitt Romney and Rick Santorum engaged in a particularly competitive primary fight in Ohio.

headline.seo: Romney and Santorum Vie for Blue-Collar Vote
headline.main: Santorum and Romney Court Blue-Collar Voters in Ohio
headline.print_headline: Romney and Santorum Roll Up Their Sleeves for Blue-Collar Votes
